questions.question: Choose the correct modal to show possibility: 'It _____ rain later, so take an umbrella.'
Which of these shows less certainty?
options: He must be the new manager.
He might be the new manager.
questions.answer: He might be the new manager.

questions.question: Choose the sentence that shows a strong possibility:
options: They could be at home now.
They might be at home now.
They must be at home now.
They would be at home now.
questions.answer: They must be at home now.

questions.question: Which sentence uses a modal of possibility correctly?
options: She can goes to the party.
She might go to the party.
She must to go to the party.
She going to the party might.
questions.answer: She might go to the party.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'We _____ see them at the concert tomorrow.'
Which modal verb best expresses uncertainty?
Choose the best option: 'There _____ be a mistake in this report.'
Which sentence expresses a possibility about the past?
options: She might have forgotten the meeting.
She will have forgotten the meeting.
questions.answer: She might have forgotten the meeting.
